N1.title: Are Student Papers More Extreme Than Institutional Twitter?
points: Compared 94 schools with sufficient data in both channels
84 of 94 schools (89%) have more extreme student papers

N2.title: Does Student Newspaper Tone Track Institutional Twitter Bias?
points: Student papers show wider variance than institutional accounts

N3.title: At Conservative Schools, Do Students Agree?
points: Compared 12 schools where institutional Twitter leans conservative
2 of 12 show agreement in direction between students and institution
Student newspapers often lean more liberal than their institution

N4.title: Does Student Newspaper Bias Track Employee Donations?
points: Student editorial lean aligns with employee donation patterns
Independent data sources converge on similar conclusions

N5.title: What Do Student Newspapers Write About by Bias Quadrant?
points: Full Progressive schools most discuss: Other, Elections & Politics, Race & Identity
Topic distribution varies meaningfully across quadrants
Race & Identity and Elections & Politics are most common across all quadrants
